Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Aha, looks like Bitmex added longs paying to shorts / shorts paying to longs thing to solve similar balance problem

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: When more shorts than longs opened - there shorts paying to longs each 8 hours and vice versa

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: As I can see in the real world situations could be often when many positions are still unbalanced, so the house is at risk to lose

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, perfect balance is never achieved

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the trick is to manage it within the range where the capital available will absorb the worst case

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://www.ccn.com/bitcoin-price-crashes-6400-triggered-35-million-sell-order

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a single trader games bitstamp price (buy dumping 2000+ BTC!) to change bitmex marked price to gain on his short positions!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: interestingly prices CC design avoids such things as we use the 24hr price so it isnt the free money the "short bitmex and dump on the market" strategy is

Author: Andersen#8337
Content: Mean  median  24Hrs  index  ?

Author: Andersen#8337
Content: Like  Bitmex marking price , but longer period

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the marking price is the 24 average of the correlated prices: http://159.69.45.70:8050/

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the green line

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: correlated price is the brown line, which is a randomly selected price from the past day that correlates with majority of price samples starting from that random price (rotating buffer)

Author: Andersen#8337
Content: great

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is still possible to mess around with prices, but only if you sustain it for better part of the day
